intro: Polygala galioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces yellowish or greenish flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soils in disturbed areas.
